div.head: Peiping #3
div.p: 3/17/50 Ä°cont'd) - China distant from Brit consular office but applicants should be warned they remain China own risk and this govt not in position protect them should they experience indignities except as protection may be effected through Brit representative.
3/23/50 - Circular tel. Control 7139 - re closing of Peiping radio 3/25/50.
3/23/50 - Deptel 259, March 23, to Peiping - If impossible evacuate, auth. place files custody BRIT except destroy classified.

3/23/50 - Peiping tel. 566, March 23 - Peiping sent Dept. all prewar files before occupation. Remaining Peiping bound volumes 1946 and 1947 all contain some classified material though volumes devoted political reports previously destroyed. Compromising material cleared out of everything up to Jan. 14 current, will be cleared from remainder before departure.
3/24/50 - Peiping tel. 590 of March 24 - USIS library delivered to Yenching University.

3/25/50 - London tel 1624, March 25 - Message received from UK Congen at Peiping March 25 - Police called to inspect radio, requesting it to cease temporarily during inspection.Refused permit for renewal of sending except to complete one plain message. Impossible to send out message reporting closing down but went off air 10:30 March 25 and equipment sealed and not yet seized. Photos taken in radio room and compound against protests
9/25/50 Mr. Corkin DC/RM stated that we have stored in Barton Hall 120 feet of files from Peiping covering all subjects, from period 1912 to closing of post.

div.head: Peiping tel. 592 March 25 - Consular radio transmitters receivers sealed 1030 today.
div.p: Peiping tel. 594 March 25 - Discontinued passport visa consular invoice services 23rd, separated all alien personnel from permanent service today. Continuing reduce alien staff temporary basis until final closure office.
DAmailing Notice #57 re official closing dato 4/10/50.

Unnumbered Tel. from Peiping April 9 - 61 cases of radio equipment shipped San Francisco. Cases 1/1-12/12 ESD property. Cases 13/1 through 31/19 DALS cases 32/1-5/4 military attache for reshipment CINCFEF Japan. Remainder cases all departmental property for transshipment Manila.
Unnumbered tel. from Peiping April 12 - turned over custody of building and movable government property to British. Codes, seals confidential material destroyed.

Unnumbered despatch from Peiping, 4/12/50 - All confidential matter in CONGEN files destroyed, remaining archives had been packed and were ready for shipment at time of departure and shipping commission given to Bryner & Co., 3-4 Marco Polo St., Peking, that by 4/12/50 company had not yet shipped and Brit. Cons. informed and charged with supervision of the final shipment.
